reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Working Children – Actors of their own protection

description.narrative: The project reduces children’s vulnerabilities to abuse and exploitation from harmful work and unsafe migration in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cote d’Ivoire, Mali, Niger, and Togo. In West Africa, 8 million children aged 5-14 years of age are involved in econ omic activities with 6 million of them working in hazardous conditions. Children engaged in labor are working from 10 to 20 hours a day. The magnitude of child rights violations throughout West Africa is among the most severe in the world. The project stre ngthens child protection systems to become effective and sustainable. Children, families and communities know how to prevent or reduce harmful effects of child labour or unsafe migration. In addition, children and care providers have improved access to ser vices (e.g. health, education and justice). The beneficiaries of this project are the most vulnerable working children. The project is implemented by African Movement of Working Children and Youth (AMWCY) and ENDA TM - Environment and Development Action in the Third World.
